alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 12:11AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Chester Creek. * WHEN...Until 600 AM AKDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas in and around Chester Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 AM AKDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly near Chester Creek. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - For Chester Creek at Arctic Blvd: At 11:15pm the stage was 4.0 feet. Flood Stage is 4.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 4.2 feet is expected early Thursday morning. Impacts: At 4.0 feet: Portions of the Chester Creek Bike Path will get inundated, especially beneath the C St Bridge - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
